scene_description_enriched: A bearded man, identified as Saint Mark by his winged lion symbol, is depicted seated on a throne. He wears a red tunic and a blue mantle, and has a golden halo. He is shown writing on a scroll with a quill in his right hand and a stylus in his left. The scroll is unfurled and rests on the back of a winged lion, which is positioned beneath him. The lion is a symbol of Saint Mark, and its wings are also visible. The background features a patterned tapestry with diamond shapes in gold, blue, and white. The throne is pink and appears to be made of wood. The scene is set against a green ground.
